thread.title: Downton Abbey episode 6: Twitter reacts as relationships unfold and a major decision is made about the Abbey - Downton Abbey TV
thread.title_full: Downton Abbey episode 6: Twitter reacts as relationships unfold and a major decision is made about the Abbey - Downton Abbey News - TV - Digital Spy

author: Megan Davies
title: Downton Abbey episode 6: Twitter reacts as relationships unfold and a major decision is made about the Abbey - Downton Abbey TV
text: Sunday night's episode of Downton Abbey may have been less bloody than last week's, but that's not to say this episode lacked any shocking moments of its own.Between complicated relationships both new and old, an unexpected new role for Cora and the unwelcome - but very necessary - decision to open the Abbey to the public to raise some funds, the latest episode of Downton had a lot to talk about and Digital Spy was on hand to find out exactly what you thought: © ITV / Nick Briggs Not everyone thinks it's a good idea to open Downton Abbey up to the public:Flashforward to Mary and George beating off the National Trust with sticks #Downton #DowntonAbbey— Marianka Swain (@mkmswain) October 25, 2015Cora: "Don't forget to exit via the gift shop, where you can buy #DowntonAbbey cushions, jigsaws and 'What's a Weekend?' t-shirts." #Downton— Jon Reed (@jonreed) October 25, 2015"and this is where we carted Lady Mary's dead Turkish diplomat down the back stairs..."#DowntonAbbey— Terence Dackombe (@SirTerence) October 25, 2015Carson may have a lot more to learn before he gets the hang of this marriage business:Feeling the urge to flick Mr Carson on the nose... #DowntonAbbey pic.twitter.com/fqgqQTMslr— Ellie Walker-Arnott (@Ellie_Wa) October 25, 2015Mrs Hughes should have tipped that dinner in Carson's lap! #DowntonAbbey— Lisa Brunning (@Eramys) October 25, 2015Next week Mrs Hughes kills Carson with a leg of lamb then cooks and eats the evidence using Mrs Patmore's mint sauce recipe. #DowntonAbbey— GlynjaminBluskies (@glynellishughes) October 25, 2015PLOT TWIST: Mrs Hughes snaps and clobbers Carson to death with his walking stick #DowntonAbbey— Daniella Graham (@daniellagraham) October 25, 2015Carson needs a good kick up the butler's pantry #DowntonAbbey— Catherine Jones (@BodenJones) October 25, 2015Fortunately, there were other characters who were more lucky in their love lives this week:Yay! Anna & Bates are having a baby Finally some good news :) #DowntonAbbey— Pritha Bardhan (@PrithaBardhan) October 11, 2015anna bates is pregnant all is right in the world #DowntonAbbey— elise (@catelynstxrks) October 11, 2015Moments between Anna and Bates are so wonderful. #Downton #TheFinalSeries pic.twitter.com/cvC3eNNwQa— Downton Abbey (@DowntonAbbey) October 25, 2015Mary and Henry have literally just made my heart explode with their cuteness. #DowntonAbbey— somegirlcalledlily (@lily_amartin) October 25, 2015Falling and fast, Henry! #Downton #TheFinalSeries pic.twitter.com/D0VyMX2lIf— Downton Abbey (@DowntonAbbey) October 25, 2015Looks like Lady Mary is trying to take over the title of sassiest character:"I don't keep my diary in my head, ask me nearer the time." Lady Mary, queen of playing it cool. #Downton #TheFinalSeries— Downton Abbey (@DowntonAbbey) October 25, 2015But we all know who that title really belongs to:"Visit an actual dining room, complete with real life tables and chairs" Have you ever considered taking to the stage, Lady Violet? #Downton— Downton Abbey (@DowntonAbbey) October 25, 2015#DowntonAbbey #DowagerGems 'I am sick & tired of logic. I do not wish to see Cora until I am used to having a traitor in the family'.— Alastair Stewart (@alstewitn) October 25, 2015Never change, Dowager CountessMary: "What else did he collect?"Dowager Countess: "Horses and women."#priceless #DowntonAbbey— Joan Harris (@factandfictions) October 26, 2015Downton Abbey continues next Sunday (November 1) at 9pm on ITV
